txt.en:
'It is good to be free of those vile creatures. That any of us ever thought they were brother hobbits is beyond me!

'Would you go to Maur Tulhau and speak with my kinsfolk there? They should know that I am safe, thanks to you.

'The village lies to the north-west of here, off a hidden path.'
'Ye say Gwin is safe? Well then, that's a good thing....'
'I wish I could be there when my folk meet ye!'
After you rescued Gwin Curhonon from the bugan-village, he told you to visit his home.
Talk to a hobbit at Maur Tulhau
The hobbit-village of Maur Tulhau lies to the north-west of Gwin Curhonon's hiding place.\n\nGwin Curhonon asked you to bring word of his rescue to his kinsfolk in Maur Tulhau.
